title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
dont know history(but no water damage), someone play with the board before.
when it arrive to me PP3V3_G3H_RTC was short, i was fix it.
now, on one usb port it show 5v 0.3a and nothing on the other, i was replace U3200 and fix some caps there and now both usb show 5v 0.3a and every 10sec its of and on again.
PPBUS_G3H 12.3V
PP3V3_3GH 3.3V

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
with battery connected:
usb port #1 is show 5v 0.3a then off and not turning on again on again(the [I]USB Voltmeter[/I] ) 
usb port  #2 5v 0a

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
Compare diode mode readings between both ports.
I suspect knocked off components, intentionally maybe.

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
all LDO look fine in diode mode and voltage.
D3387 was off i was replace  it.
also D3320 was bad and i was replace it.
still act the same..

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
both 5v 0.25-0.3A whiteout battery.
with battery: its start 5V 0.3A and then sown to 0A and when i take the charger out and plug again its dead, until I'm unplug the battery

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message: What was the shorted component on 3V3_G3H_RTC?

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
"it arrive to me PP3V3_G3H_RTC was short"
C7690 isn't on 3V3_G3H_RTC.

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
i was put 1v with high AMP and after a 1sec the short was disappear and i was get 3.3v on 3V3_G3H_RTC,
i didnt see and bad cap on  3V3_G3H_RTC rail and C7690 was missing so i thought maybe he was blow out.
weird but all  3V3_G3H_RTC rail look o.k.

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
The "hidden" culprit on 3V3_G3H_RTC is probably the real problem.
This repair is probably waste of time, after board was messed off in other place.

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message: But 3V3_G3H_RTC rail not so big, what I need to search for?

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message: Look if something looks cracked/burnt there.

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
Don’t find one, but if I get 3.3v on this rail, so the rail is fine no?
Do C7690 is important?

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
C7690 is not so critical as Apple wants you to believe.

You have now correct 3V3_G3H_RTC, but there is a bad component; which doesn't make its job.

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 90321, member: 682"]
which doesn't make its job.
[/QUOTE]
And it can be the reason for 20v?

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
Unfortunately, yes.
Critical components, like T2, PMIC and CD3217 chips are powered from this rail.

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
You may find that is correct value, comparing with working board.

Looks like wasting time, once you can't find what was bad component connected to 3V3_G3H_RTC.
Short has gone, but think that internal connection is broken now; it is not powered in fact.

title: 820-01958 5V 0.3A
message:
Sorry can’t release it😅.
Notice that pp5v rails are missing, no short.
